document.title: Raman Under LN<sub>2</sub>: A Simple Approach to Low Temperature Raman Spectroscopy
document.abstract: Conventional low temperature Raman Spectroscopy techniques utilize expensive equipment to cool a sample to 77Ëš K. In this work, a new technique for performing Raman Spectroscopy at liquid nitrogen temperatures is presented. This technique of taking data with the sample placed under liquid nitrogen provides a low cost alternative to conventional methods, and can be utilized by any lab with a Raman spectrometer without the purchase of additional equipment. Representative spectra for CCl4, C60, and Single Wall Carbon Nanotubes at room temperature and under liquid nitrogen are shown and compared as validation of the utility of this technique.
